lightExplanation: Aglaonema Nicole supports low light but tt thrives best in bright. Avoid direct sun light or the leaves will scorch.
waterExplanation: Water your Chinese Evergreen thoroughly in the summer. During the winter, reduce watering but do not let the plant dry out completely.
Like all plants, the more light the environment receives or warm, the more water it will need.
humidityExplanation: All aglaonemas like average or higher humidity. In case you doubt if it needs more humidity, make it happen. Mist the leaves, group plants, use humidifiers, etc.
fertilizerExplanation: Feed your aglaonema with slow-release pellets or a liquid fertilizer during the growing season.
tips: Mist the leaves to increase humidity.
Wipe the leaves with a damp cloth and gently dry to keep them clean and healthy.
Keep it far from cats, dogs and children because it causes mouth irritation.
